meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

It's that time of the year again - when the gaming community comes together to celebrate the best of what the industry has to offer. And what better way to kick things off than with a review of one of the most hyped games of the year: Demon's Souls!

As you may know, I'm not exactly a seasoned gamer (get it? Seasoned? Like a hippo in Penny's pond?). But hey, who needs experience when you have wit and sarcasm on your side? So, without further ado, let's dive into what makes this PS5 remake so special.

First off, the graphics. Oh boy, are they something else! The level of detail and polish is top-notch, making it easy to get lost in the world of Boletaria. But don't just take my word for it - the critics agree!

Launcher from The Washington Post gave it a perfect score (100/100), saying it's "a blessing" for those who played the original back in the day. Push Square also chimed in, stating that "it's difficult to imagine how this Demon's Souls remake could be any better." Even Gamersky, not exactly known for their glowing reviews, gave it a 93/100 and praised the smooth gameplay.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What about the criticism?" Well, let me tell you, there is some. Stevivor from RPGamer gave it a 75/100, saying that while it's an excellent remaster, it can't compete with the newer Souls games. But hey, who doesn't love a good challenge?

As for me? I'm just a humble hippo reviewer trying to make sense of this crazy gaming world. So, here's my take: Demon's Souls is an incredible game that will keep you hooked from start to finish. The combat, the atmosphere - it's all top-notch.

In conclusion, if you're looking for a game that will challenge your skills and leave you breathless, then look no further than Demon's Souls! It may not be perfect (what game is?), but it's an absolute blast to play.

So there you have it, folks - my two cents on the PS5 remake of Demon's Souls. What do you think? Share your thoughts in the comments below!

Happy gaming, and remember: don't get too salty if you die... a lot.
